summary: This is an internal Public Corruption Unit update memo dated October 2, 2020, detailing significant developments in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It covers her indictment and arrest, discovery production, coordination with other agencies, and efforts to interview Prince Andrew via an MLAT request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged in a six-count indictment for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls. She was arrested and detained.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The prosecution team is pursuing a potential interview with him. After his counsel declined a voluntary interview, the team initiated an MLAT request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the central figure whose abuse of minor girls was facilitated by Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged for her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minor girls.
The prosecution's pursuit of an interview with Prince Andrew is mentioned in the context of the Maxwell case, implying a potential connection.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury returned a six-count indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at a residence in New Hampshire and has been detained since.

events.title: Initial Discovery Production
events.description: The prosecution team made an initial discovery production in the Maxwell case.

events.title: MLAT Request for Prince Andrew Interview
events.description: After Prince Andrew's counsel declined a voluntary interview, the prosecution team notified they wished to proceed with a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to interview him.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.
Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in New Hampshire and has been detained since her arrest.
The prosecution is coordinating with multiple agencies, including the USAO-SDFL, OPR, and the West Palm Beach Police Department, to obtain materials from prior investigations.
The prosecution is pursuing a potential interview with Prince Andrew and, after his counsel declined a voluntary interview, has initiated an MLAT request to compel his cooperation.
The prosecution is in initial discussions with counsel for an individual referred to as 'MI' about the possibility of a felony disposition.
